results.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes
results.title: Ukraine’s Demands for More Weapons Clash With U.S. Concerns
results.abstract: Pulling Ukrainians out of battle to train them could accelerate Russia’s gains, officials say. The Pentagon is also monitoring the levels of its own stockpiles.

media.caption: Some officials are concerned that pulling too many Ukrainian artillery specialists off the front lines could weaken Ukrainian defenses.

results.adx_keywords: Space and Astronomy;James Webb Space Telescope
results.byline: By Dennis Overbye, Kenneth Chang and Jim Tankersley
results.title: Biden and NASA Share First Webb Space Telescope Image
results.abstract: From the White House on Monday, humanity got its first glimpse of what the observatory in space has been seeing: a cluster of early galaxies.

media.caption: The Webb telescope’s image of the galaxy cluster SMACS 0723 includes thousands of galaxies, including the faintest objects ever observed in infrared. The light from SMACS 0723 in this image is 4.6 billion years old.

results.title: 40 Years Later, Nevada Man Is Charged With Murdering a 5-Year-Old Girl
results.abstract: Analysis of the DNA in a single strand of rootless hair from a 1982 crime scene helped lead the authorities to arrest Robert J. Lanoue, a 70-year-old registered sex offender, officials said.

media.caption: Last week, after the authorities made an arrest in the 1982 killing of Anne Pham, police officials displayed her picture at Highland Elementary School in Seaside, Calif. She was kidnapped, sexually assaulted and murdered on her way to school.
